TITLE: Injecting StateHolder in Compose
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to inject a UserStateHolder into a Jetpack Compose Composable using the `koinInject()` function. This allows direct access to the StateHolder's methods within the UI.

SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/docs/quickstart/android-compose.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
@Composable
fun FactoryInject(userName : String, presenter: UserStateHolder = koinInject()){
 Text(text = presenter.sayHello(userName), modifier = Modifier.padding(8.dp))
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Koin Compose - Deprecated vs New Inject Functions
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the deprecation of older Koin Compose injection functions and the recommended new alternatives. The new functions provide a more consistent and type-safe way to inject dependencies in Compose.

SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/docs/support/releases.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
// Deprecated:
// val myService = inject<MyService>()
// val myViewModel = getViewModel<MyViewModel>()
// val rememberedInject = rememberKoinInject<MyOtherService>()

// Recommended:
import org.koin.compose.koinInject
import org.koin.compose.koinViewModel

@Composable
fun MyComponent() {
 val myService: MyService = koinInject()
 val myViewModel: MyViewModel = koinViewModel()
 val rememberedInject: MyOtherService = rememberKoinInject()
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Injecting into @Composable Functions
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the basic usage of `koinInject()` to retrieve instances of dependencies directly within a Composable function. It shows how to inject a service when the module declares it.

SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/docs/reference/koin-compose/compose.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
val androidModule = module {
 single { MyService() }
 // or constructor DSL
 singleOf(::MyService)
}

@Composable
fun App() {
 val myService = koinInject<MyService>()
}
```

TITLE: Injecting UserPresenter in Android Compose
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to inject the `UserPresenter` into an Android Compose UI using the `koinInject` function. This allows the UI to access the presenter's functionality to display greetings.

SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/docs/quickstart/kmp.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
// in App()

val greeting = koinInject<UserPresenter>().sayHello("Koin")

Column(Modifier.fillMaxWidth(), horizontalAlignment = Alignment.CenterHorizontally) {
 Image(painterResource(Res.drawable.compose_multiplatform), null)
 Text("Compose: $greeting")
}
```

========================
QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS
========================
TOPIC: Kotlin Multiplatform - No shared UI Tutorial
Q: How can Koin instances be retrieved in an Android Compose UI?
A: Koin instances can be retrieved in an Android Compose UI using the `koinInject()` compose function. This function allows you to inject dependencies directly into your composable functions.


SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/docs/quickstart/kmp.md#_qa_6

----------------------------------------

TOPIC: Android - Jetpack Compose with Koin
Q: How do you add the Koin Android dependency for Jetpack Compose?
A: You add the Koin Android dependency by including `implementation "io.insert-koin:koin-androidx-compose:$koin_version"` in your Gradle dependencies block.


SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/docs/quickstart/android-compose.md#_qa_1

----------------------------------------

TOPIC: Koin for Jetpack Compose and Compose Multiplatform
Q: What is the recommended approach for injecting dependencies into `@Composable` functions with Koin?
A: The recommended approach is to inject instances directly into the parameters of your composable functions using `koinInject()`. This promotes a functional style and allows for flexibility in providing dependencies.


SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/docs/reference/koin-compose/compose.md#_qa_4

----------------------------------------

TOPIC: Android - Jetpack Compose with Koin
Q: How can you inject a factory component into a Jetpack Compose Composable using Koin?
A: You can inject a factory component into a Jetpack Compose Composable using the `koinInject()` function. For example, `presenter: UserStateHolder = koinInject()` injects an instance of `UserStateHolder`.


SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/docs/quickstart/android-compose.md#_qa_9

----------------------------------------

TOPIC: Koin Project Setup
Q: Which Koin dependency should be used for Jetpack Compose or Compose Multiplatform projects?
A: For Jetpack Compose or Compose Multiplatform, you should use the 'koin-compose' dependency. For pure Android Jetpack Compose, 'koin-androidx-compose' is recommended.


SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/docs/setup/koin.md#_qa_5

----------------------------------------

TOPIC: Koin Project Documentation
Q: What are the dependencies for the 'androidJacocoAnt' configuration in the ':compose:koin-androidx-compose-navigation' project?
A: The 'androidJacocoAnt' configuration depends on 'org.jacoco:org.jacoco.ant:0.8.8'. This, in turn, relies on 'org.jacoco:org.jacoco.core:0.8.8', 'org.jacoco:org.jacoco.report:0.8.8', and 'org.jacoco:org.jacoco.agent:0.8.8'.


SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/projects/deps.txt#_qa_6

----------------------------------------

TOPIC: Koin Project Documentation
Q: What is the purpose of the 'androidApis' configuration in the ':compose:koin-androidx-compose-navigation' project?
A: The 'androidApis' configuration provides various types of Android JAR files. It currently has no dependencies listed.


SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/projects/deps.txt#_qa_4

----------------------------------------

TOPIC: Koin Project Documentation
Q: What is the purpose of 'androidTestCompileOnly' and 'androidTestDebugCompileOnly' configurations in Koin projects?
A: These configurations specify dependencies that are only needed during the compilation phase for Android tests and debug Android tests, respectively. They are not included in the runtime classpath.


SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/projects/deps.txt#_qa_9

----------------------------------------

TOPIC: Koin Project Documentation
Q: What is the purpose of the 'androidJdkImage' configuration in Koin projects?
A: The 'androidJdkImage' configuration provides the JDK image necessary for compiling Java 9+ sources. It does not have any listed dependencies.


SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/projects/deps.txt#_qa_7

----------------------------------------

TOPIC: Koin Project Documentation
Q: What warning is displayed for Maven publishing in Android Gradle Plugin 8.0 for Koin projects?
A: For Maven publishing with Android Gradle Plugin 8.0, a warning is displayed stating that Software Components will not be created automatically. To opt-in to future behavior, the Gradle property android.disableAutomaticComponentCreation=true should be set in the `gradle.properties` file or the new publishing DSL should be used.


SOURCE: https://github.com/insertkoinio/koin/blob/main/projects/deps.txt#_qa_2)"}]}
